page.title: 11Dunchurch Church,Nr.Rugby
page.content: Grid ref.486713 The Dunchurch Church is called St.Peters Church. The vicar is the Reverend Hughes who is now Rural Dean. The building of the Church was begun in 1346 and most of the building was done by monks of the Cistercian Abbey at Pipewell in Northamptonshire,which was founded in 1143,during the reign of King Stephen. A previous Church was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. Interesting architectural features include two aumbries in the North wall which were,in the past,used for the storage of Church silver and possibly other valuables.The stained glass windows are all modern but high in quality.There are six bells_the tenor weighs 18cwt 12lb.Holy Communion is celebrated every Sunday and there is Evensong three Sundays a month.
